韓.definition: Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄; Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897; Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国; surname Han

韓世昌.definition: Han Shichang (1897-1977), actor specializing in Kunqu opera 崑曲|昆曲[Kun1 qu3]

韓亞龍.definition: H Mart, Korean supermarket chain in US and Canada

韓信.definition: Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]

韓國.definition: South Korea (Republic of Korea); Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄[zhan4 guo2 qi1 xiong2]; Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897

韓國瑜.definition: Daniel Han Kuo-yu (1957-), Taiwanese KMT politician, mayor of Kaohsiung since 2018

韓國聯合通訊社.pinyin: hán guó lián hé tōng xùn shè

韓城.definition: see 韓城市|韩城市[Han2cheng2 Shi4]

韓城市.definition: Hancheng, a county-level and sub-prefectural city of historic significance in Weinan 渭南市[Wei4nan2 Shi4], Shaanxi

韓寒.definition: Han Han (1982-), PRC blogger, singer and professional rally driver

韓山師範學院.pinyin: hán shān shī fàn xué yuàn

韓彥直.definition: Han Yanzhi (1131-?), Song dynasty botanist, author of classification of orange trees 橘錄|橘录[ju2 lu4]

韓復榘.definition: Han Fuju (1890-1938), Nationalist Kuomintang (KMT) army general and governor of Shandong, executed by Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4shi2] after he abandoned Jinan to the Japanese

韓德爾.definition: (Tw) Handel (name); George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born British composer

韓愈.definition: Han Yu (768-824), Tang dynasty essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动[gu3 wen2 yun4 dong4] and neoclassical 復古|复古[fu4 gu3] movements

韓愛晶.definition: Han Aijing (1945-), notorious red guard leader during Cultural Revolution, spent 15 years in prison for imprisoning and torturing political leaders

韓文.definition: hangul, Korean phonetic alphabet; Korean written language

韓文字母.definition: hangul, Korean phonetic alphabet; Korean letters

韓昇洙.definition: Han Seung-soo (1936-), South Korean diplomat and politician, prime minister 2008-2009

韓朝.definition: North and South Korea; bilateral Korean relations

韓正.definition: Han Zheng (1954-), senior vice premier of the PRC (2018-)

韓流.definition: Korean Wave, aka Hallyu (the increase in international interest in South Korea and its popular culture since the 1990s)

韓素音.definition: Han Suyin (1917-2012), Eurasian physician and author

韓語.definition: Korean language (esp. in context of South Korea)

韓邦慶.definition: Han Bangqing (1856-1894), writer and publisher of experimental literary journal in Classical Chinese and Jiangsu vernacular, author of novel 海上花列傳|海上花列传

韓非.definition: Han Fei, also known as Han Feizi 韓非子|韩非子[Han2 Fei1 zi3] (c. 280-233 BC), Legalist philosopher of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)

韓非子.definition: another name for Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1], Legalist philosopher (c. 280-233 BC); Han Feizi, book of Legalist Philosophy authored by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
